maml:description.maml:para: Connects and creates a session to the Microsoft Graph API.
The Connect-odsc function authenticates and creates a session to the Microsoft Graph API.
Specifies a certificate that has been configured in the Azure AD application for authentication.
Specifies a string that contains the client ID of the Azure AD application.
Species a string that contains the tenant ID of the Azure/365 environment of the Azure AD application.
Specifies a string that contains the client ID of the Azure AD application.
Specifies a secure string that contains the client secret that has been configured in the Azure AD application for authentication.
Species a string that contains the tenant ID of the Azure/365 environment of the Azure AD application.
Specifies a certificate that has been configured in the Azure AD application for authentication.
Specifies a string that contains the client ID of the Azure AD application.
Specifies a secure string that contains the client secret that has been configured in the Azure AD application for authentication.
Species a string that contains the tenant ID of the Azure/365 environment of the Azure AD application.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Connect using a client secret

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command connects to the Microsoft Graph API using a client secret configured in the Azure AD application.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Connect using a client certificate

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command connects to the Microsoft Graph API using a client certificate configured in the Azure AD application.

maml:description.maml:para: Disconnects the session for the Microsoft Graph API.
The Disconnect-odsc function clears the session for the Microsoft Graph API.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command clears the saved session.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve the properties and relationships of a Drive resource.
The Get-odscDrive function gets the metadata for a a user's OneDrive drive.
Specifies a string that contains the ID of a OneDrive user.
Specifies a string that contains the user principal name of a OneDrive user.
Specifies a string that contains the ID of a OneDrive user.
Specifies a string that contains the user principal name of a OneDrive user.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the OneDrive drive for the user "user@contoso.com".

maml:description.maml:para: Get metadata for a OneDrive shortcut to SharePoint.
The Get-odsc function gets the metadata for a shortcut in a user's OneDrive that points to a SharePoint/Teams document library or subfolder.
Specifies a string that contains the shortcut name of the shortcut.
Specifies a string that contains the ID of a OneDrive user.
Specifies a string that contains the shortcut name of the shortcut.
Specifies a string that contains the user principal name of a OneDrive user.
Specifies a string that contains the shortcut name of the shortcut.
Specifies a string that contains the ID of a OneDrive user.
Specifies a string that contains the user principal name of a OneDrive user.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the shortcut called "Working Folder" for the user "user@contoso.com".

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get a OneDrive shortcut placed in subfolder

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the shortcut called "Working Folder" under "subfolder1/subfolder2" for the user "user@contoso.com".

maml:description.maml:para: Create OneDrive shortcut to SharePoint.
The New-odsc function creates a shortcut in a user's OneDrive that points to a SharePoint/Teams document library or subfolder.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a string that contains the document library name.
Specifies a string that contains the folder path inside of the document library.
Specifies a string that contains the name of the shortcut to be placed in the user's OneDrive.
Specifeis a string that contains the URL of the SharePoint site.
Specifies a string that contains the ID of a OneDrive user.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a string that contains the document library name.
Specifies a string that contains the folder path inside of the document library.
Specifies a string that contains the folder path inside of the user's OneDrive where the shortcut will be placed.
Specifies a string that contains the name of the shortcut to be placed in the user's OneDrive.
Specifies a string that contains the URL of the SharePoint site.
Specifies a string that contains the user principal name of a OneDrive user.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a string that contains the document library name.
Specifies a string that contains the folder path inside of the document library.
Specifies a string that contains the folder path inside of the user's OneDrive where the shortcut will be placed.
Specifies a string that contains the name of the shortcut to be placed in the user's OneDrive.
Specifies a string that contains the URL of the SharePoint site.
Specifies a string that contains the ID of a OneDrive user.
Specifies a string that contains the user principal name of a OneDrive user.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create a shortcut to the root of a document library

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a shortcut called "Working Document Library" for the user "user@contoso.com" that points to the Document Library called "Working Document Library" on the SharePoint site "https://contoso.sharepoint.com/sites/WorkingSite".

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Create a shortcut to the root of a document library with a custom name
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-odsc -SiteUrl "https://contoso.sharepoint.com/sites/WorkingSite" -DocumentLibrary "Working Document Library" -UserPrincipalName "user@contoso.com" -ShortcutName "Working DL"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a shortcut called "Working DL" for the user "user@contoso.com" that points to the Document Library called "Working Document Library" on the SharePoint site "https://contoso.sharepoint.com/sites/WorkingSite".

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Create a shortcut to a subfolder of a document library
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-odsc -SiteUrl "https://contoso.sharepoint.com/sites/WorkingSite" -DocumentLibrary "Working Document Library" -FolderPath "Working Folder" -UserPrincipalName "user@contoso.com"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a shortcut called "Working Folder" for the user "user@contoso.com" that points to the subfolder "Working Folder" of the Document Library called "Working Document Library" on the SharePoint site "https://contoso.sharepoint.com/sites/WorkingSite".

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Create a shortcut to a subfolder of a document library with a custom name
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-odsc -SiteUrl "https://contoso.sharepoint.com/sites/WorkingSite" -DocumentLibrary "Working Document Library" -FolderPath "Working Folder" -ShortcutName "Working" -UserPrincipalName "user@contoso.com"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a shortcut called "Working" for the user "user@contoso.com" that points to the subfolder "Working Folder" of the Document Library called "Working Document Library" on the SharePoint site "https://contoso.sharepoint.com/sites/WorkingSite".

command:example.maml:title: Example 5: Create a shortcut to the root of a document library in a subfolder of the user's OneDrive

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a shortcut in the subfolder "subfolder1/subfolder2" for the user "user@contoso.com" that points to the Document Library called "Working Document Library" on the SharePoint site "https://contoso.sharepoint.com/sites/WorkingSite".

maml:description.maml:para: Removes OneDrive shortcut to SharePoint.
The Remove-odsc function removes a shortcut in a user's OneDrive that points to a SharePoint/Teams document library or subfolder.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a string that contains the folder path inside of the user's OneDrive where the shortcut is placed.
Specifies a string that contains the shortcut name of the shortcut.
Specifies a string that contains the ID of a OneDrive user.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a string that contains the folder path inside of the user's OneDrive where the shortcut is placed.
Specifies a string that contains the shortcut name of the shortcut.
Specifies a string that contains the user principal name of a OneDrive user.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a string that contains the folder path inside of the user's OneDrive where the shortcut is placed.
Specifies a string that contains the shortcut name of the shortcut.
Specifies a string that contains the ID of a OneDrive user.
Specifies a string that contains the user principal name of a OneDrive user.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the shortcut called "Working Folder" for the user "user@contoso.com".

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Remove a OneDrive shortcut in subfolder

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the shortcut called "Working Folder" under "subfolder1/subfolder2" for the user "user@contoso.com".
